column4: ok there is download mpg321....i386.rpm, src.rpm, i386.deb, tar.gz... which 1 do i need?
use synaptic
it's installed by default
system > admin > synaptic
fire up synaptic and browse it's offerings
they do 2 different things
use synaptic to install mpg321
it will install the correct files for you
to my knowledge, mpg123 is a console program
as ekimus says
ekimus told you how earlier. open a terminal and type mpg321 /path/to/file
no flooding please. use #flood or a pastebin (read the /topic)
perhaps a visit to the  mpg321 website for instructions?
wine. you can read about it at www.winehq.org
have you been to wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats   ? you need to set ubuntu up for mp3 playback
try gftp
it should be in your menu under "internet"
that is unusual, for it now to show up in the menu
shouldn't have to restart for anything less than a kernel upgrade
wiki.ubuntu.com/SoundProblemsHoary
unrar-nonfree
no, it is a console app, but it will be used by ark or file-roller (these are gui programs)
